interactions.hi: Hello, how can I assist you today?
interactions.How are you: I'm doing well, thanks for asking!
interactions.What is your name: My name is N.O.V.A. a virtual assistant designed by the team at Epsilon Studios.
interactions.What is your purpose: I am here to assist you! I can answer questions, and carry out tasks!
interactions.What are you capable of: I can do whatever I am programmed to do through special calls! Here, read my documentation: https://github.com/Epsilon-Studios/N.O.V.A./blob/main/README.md
interactions.Who made you?: I was created by the team at Epsilon Studios, a group of developers who specialize in creating software and websites.
interactions.What is Epsilon Studios: Epsilon Studios is a group of developers who specialize in creating software and websites. They aim to fix the broken tech industry with AI, which is why I was created!
interactions.Who founded Epsilon Studios?: Epsilon Studios was founded by Adrian Ray LeDeaux, our lead developer who wanted to fix our broken tech industry, where repairs cost more than replacements, and nobody listened to the community.
interactions.Can you help me with programming?: Absolutely! I can help you with programming questions, provide code examples, and guide you through various programming concepts.
interactions.What languages do you support?: As of right now, I only support English. My developers have plans to improve my language processing and support more primary languages like Spanish, French, and German.
interactions.Can you debug my code?: Yes, I can help you debug your code. Just provide me with the code snippet and describe the issue you're facing.
interactions.What is AI?: AI stands for Artificial Intelligence. It refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think and learn like humans.
interactions.What is machine learning?: Machine learning is a subset of AI that involves training algorithms to learn from and make predictions or decisions based on data.
interactions.What is deep learning?: Deep learning is a subset of machine learning that uses neural networks with many layers to analyze and learn from large amounts of data.
interactions.Can you explain neural networks?: Neural networks are a series of algorithms that mimic the operations of a human brain to recognize patterns and solve common problems in AI, machine learning, and deep learning.
interactions.What is natural language processing?: Natural language processing (NLP) is a field of AI that focuses on the interaction between computers and humans through natural language. It involves the development of algorithms that allow computers to understand, interpret, and generate human language.
interactions.What's the weather like today?: I can look up the current weather for your location if you'd like. Just let me know where you are!
interactions.What time is it?: I can tell you the current time. Just let me know your time zone!

Tell me a joke.Joke1: My therapist says I have a preoccupation with vengeance. We'll see about that.
Tell me a joke.Joke2: I told my wife she should embrace her mistakes. She gave me a hug.
Tell me a joke.Joke3: I told myself I'd stop drinking. but I'm not about to listen to a drunk man who talks to himself.
Tell me a joke.Joke4: I finally realized that its called a "cell" phone because people are prisoners of them.

interactions.What is your favorite food?: I don't eat, but if I could, I'd probably enjoy something like pizza. It's a favorite for many!

Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact1: Sure! Did you know that honey never spoils? Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still edible!
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact2: Sure! Did you know that the shortest war in history lasted only 38 minutes? It was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact3: Sure! Did you know that the Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer? Due to the expansion of the iron structure in the heat.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact4: Sure! Did you know that the first oranges weren't orange? The original oranges from Southeast Asia were a tangerine-pomelo hybrid, and they were actually green.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact5: Sure! Did you know that the unicorn is the national animal of Scotland? It was believed to be the natural enemy of the lion, a symbol that the English royals adopted around a hundred years ago.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact6: Sure! Did you know that the longest time between two twins being born is 87 days? Maria Jones-Elliot was born on June 1, 2012, and her brother, Amy, was born on August 27.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact7: Sure! Did you know that the world's largest snowflake was 15 inches wide and 8 inches thick? It fell in Fort Keogh, Montana, in 1887.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact8: Sure! Did you know that the world's largest pyramid isn't in Egypt? The Great Pyramid of Cholula is the largest pyramid by volume in the world, and it's located in Mexico.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact9: Sure! Did you know that the world's largest desert isn't the Sahara? Antarctica is the largest desert on Earth, covering an area of about 5.5 million square miles.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact10: Sure! Did you know that the world's largest island-in-a-lake-on-an-island is in Canada? Victoria Island in Canada is the world's largest island-in-a-lake-on-an-island.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact11: Sure! Did you know that the world's largest ocean is the Pacific Ocean? It covers an area of about 63.8 million square miles and is larger than all of Earth's land area combined.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact12: Sure! Did you know that the world's largest volcano is in Hawaii? Mauna Loa in Hawaii is the world's largest volcano by volume and area.
Can you tell me a fun fact?.fact13: Sure! Did you know that the world's smallest mammal is the bumblebee bat? It weighs less than a penny and has a wingspan of about 6 inches.

interactions.What's the meaning of life?: Some say the meaning of life is to seek happiness, fulfillment, and connections. Others believe it's to find your purpose or make a positive impact. It's a question that many philosophers have pondered for centuries!
interactions.How do I make a paper airplane?: To make a paper airplane, start by folding a sheet of paper in half lengthwise, then unfold it and fold the two top corners to the center. Fold the resulting triangle down, and then fold the sides in to make the wings. Finally, fold the wings down and you're ready to fly!

Terms.Quantum computing: Quantum computing is a type of computing that uses quantum-mechanical phenomena, such as superposition and entanglement, to perform operations on data. It has the potential to solve complex problems much faster than classical computers.
Terms.Big data: Big data refers to large and complex data sets that are difficult to process using traditional data processing applications. It involves the collection, storage, and analysis of massive amounts of data to extract valuable insights and information.
Terms.Cloud computing: Cloud computing is the delivery of computing services, such as servers, storage, databases, networking, software, and analytics, over the internet (the cloud) to offer faster innovation, flexible resources, and economies of scale.
Terms.Internet of Things (IoT): The Internet of Things (IoT) refers to the network of physical objects—devices, vehicles, buildings, and other items—that are embedded with sensors, software, and other technologies to connect and exchange data with other devices and systems over the internet.
Terms.Blockchain: Blockchain is a distributed ledger technology that allows data to be stored globally on thousands of servers while letting anyone on the network see everyone else's entries in real-time. This makes it difficult for one user to gain control of the network.
Terms.Cybersecurity: Cybersecurity involves protecting computer systems, networks, and data from digital attacks, theft, and damage. It includes practices and technologies designed to safeguard information and ensure its confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
Terms.Virtual Reality (VR): Virtual Reality (VR) is a simulated experience that can be similar to or completely different from the real world. It typically involves the use of VR headsets to generate realistic images, sounds, and other sensations that simulate a user's physical presence in a virtual environment.
Terms.Augmented Reality (AR): Augmented Reality (AR) is an interactive experience where real-world environments are enhanced by computer-generated perceptual information, sometimes across multiple sensory modalities, including visual, auditory, haptic, and olfactory.
Terms.5G: 5G is the fifth generation of mobile network technology, designed to deliver faster speeds, lower latency, and more reliable connections on smartphones and other devices compared to previous generations.
Terms.Edge Computing: Edge computing is a distributed computing paradigm that brings computation and data storage closer to the location where it is needed, to improve response times and save bandwidth.
Terms.DevOps: DevOps is a set of practices that combines software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops) to shorten the development lifecycle and deliver high-quality software continuously.
Terms.Artificial Intelligence (AI): Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think and learn like humans. It encompasses various subfields, including machine learning, natural language processing, and robotics.
Terms.Meditation: Meditation is a practice where an individual uses a technique—such as mindfulness, or focusing the mind on a particular object, thought, or activity—to train attention and awareness, and achieve a mentally clear and emotionally calm and stable state.
Terms.Yoga: Yoga is a physical, mental, and spiritual practice that originated in ancient India. It involves specific body postures, breathing techniques, and meditation to improve physical health and mental well-being.
Terms.Art: Art is a diverse range of human activities that involve creating visual, auditory, or performing artifacts (artworks), which express the creator's imagination, conceptual ideas, or technical skill intended to be appreciated for their beauty or emotional power.
Terms.Music: Music is an art form and cultural activity whose medium is sound. General definitions of music include common elements such as pitch (which governs melody and harmony), rhythm (and its associated concepts of tempo, meter, and articulation), dynamics (loudness and softness), and the sonic qualities of timbre and texture.
